article.headline: Appalachian St. 98, Tennessee Tech 87
article.story: BOONE, N.C. (AP) -- Chris McFarland scored a team season-high 26 points to lead Appalachian State to a 98-87 win over Tennessee Tech on Saturday. Three Appalachian State players set career scoring highs: Derek Thomas with 23 points, D.J. Thompson with 17 and freshman Douglass McLaughlin-Williams with seven. Noah Brown added 14 points for the Mountaineers (2-1). Tennessee Tech (1-2) was led by Willie Jenkins' 24 points, while Derek Stribling added 15, Ben Jacobson had 12 and Milone Clark had 10 points. The Golden Eagles held a 42-40 halftime lead behind Jenkins' 13 first-half points. Both teams traded baskets before Corwin Davis landed a three-pointer giving the Mountaineers a one-point lead. The Mountaineers went on a 15-2 run through the eight-minute mark. A technical foul for the Golden Eagles bench allowed Appalachian St. to add another three points, putting them ahead 80-69.
